intro: Thelechitonia trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it survive in arid and cold environments. Its flowers are typically white or pink and are borne in dense inflorescences. Thelechitonia trilobata is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
